title-group.article-title: Corporate Takeover Bids, Methods of Payment, and the Effects of Leverage

abstract.p: Recent research examining the role of the method of payment in explaining common stock returns of bidding firms at the announcement of takeover bids shows significant differences between the abnormal returns in cash and stock transactions. These differences may reflect differences in changes in leverage in addition to, or perhaps rather than, differences in method of payment. This study tests for a leverage effect while controlling for the method of payment. The results indicate a strong leverage impact on the abnormal returns to acquiring firms' shareholders in addition to the method of payment effect.
